channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What do you know about space? Take our Space Camp final exam to find out!
item.description: Put you knowledge of all things space to the test with these 10 questions — and then earn an official Short Wave badge with your name on it.
item.content:encoded:
Put you knowledge of all things space to the test with these 10 questions — and then earn an official Short Wave badge with your name on it.

(Image credit: Credit: X-ray: NASA/CXO/SAO; Infrared: NASA/ESA/CSA/STScI; Image processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/L. Frattare)

item.title: Highlights from Musk's Trump interview. And, Ozempic may lower cancer risk
item.description: Elon Musk's interview with former President Donald Trump remained light on news as he rehashed similar talking points. And, GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic may help lower the risk of cancer.
item.content:encoded:
Elon Musk's interview with former President Donald Trump remained light on news as he rehashed similar talking points. And, GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic may help lower the risk of cancer.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The Olympic flag was passed to LA. How will everyone get around the car-choked city?
item.description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass promised a "no car" Olympics when the summer games come to her city in 2028. How is her plan going to work in a city famous for large freeways and a lot of traffic?
item.content:encoded: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass promised a "no car" Olympics when the summer games come to her city in 2028. How is her plan going to work in a city famous for large freeways and a lot of traffic?
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Weekend matchup: Harris and Trump campaigned on the same day. Hear the contrast
item.description: VP Harris was in Nevada with her running mate, and ex-president Trump campaigned for a Senate candidate in Montana. The same-day appearances is a chance to hear the contrast in substance and style.
item.content:encoded: VP Harris was in Nevada with her running mate, and ex-president Trump campaigned for a Senate candidate in Montana. The same-day appearances is a chance to hear the contrast in substance and style.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: Her son died of an overdose in his dorm room. Where was the Narcan?
item.description: Drug overdoses on college campuses are not tracked, and rarely publicized, as colleges cite health privacy laws. But advocates are working to make overdose reversal treatment widely available on campus.
item.content:encoded:
Drug overdoses on college campuses are not tracked, and rarely publicized, as colleges cite health privacy laws. But advocates are working to make overdose reversal treatment widely available on campus.

(Image credit: Mette Lampcov for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: The Economic Mind of Tim Walz
item.description: A rundown on some of the Democratic VP candidate’s important economic policy decisions.
item.content:encoded:
A rundown on some of the Democratic VP candidate’s important economic policy decisions.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Here’s how you can keep finding new sports to love between now and the next Olympics
item.description: One of the joys of watching the Olympics is getting sucked into sports you’ve barely heard of. If you still need that feeling in your life, these sports are out beyond the Olympic fringe.
item.content:encoded:
One of the joys of watching the Olympics is getting sucked into sports you’ve barely heard of. If you still need that feeling in your life, these sports are out beyond the Olympic fringe.

(Image credit: Christopher Pike)
item.dc:creator: Christopher Dean Hopkins

item.title: Opinion: Want to reform the Supreme Court? These strongmen can show a thing or two
item.description: The champions of U.S. Supreme Court reform should first consider the record of nations that wound up packing and purging their judiciaries.
item.content:encoded:
The champions of U.S. Supreme Court reform should first consider the record of nations that wound up packing and purging their judiciaries.

(Image credit: Pedro Rances Mattey)
item.dc:creator: Mac Margolis

item.title: Puerto Rico cancels classes, activates National Guard as Tropical Storm Ernesto nears
item.description: Puerto Rico activated the National Guard and canceled the start of classes in public schools as forecasters warned that the U.S. territory would be hit by Tropical Storm Ernesto.
item.content:encoded:
Puerto Rico activated the National Guard and canceled the start of classes in public schools as forecasters warned that the U.S. territory would be hit by Tropical Storm Ernesto.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Mars and Jupiter pair up this week in a celestial dance unseen from Earth in years
item.description: The encounter is an out-of-this-world example of right place, right time — as Mars zips past Jupiter, Earth will be in the perfect spot to see the two planets look as if they are within arm's reach.
item.content:encoded:
The encounter is an out-of-this-world example of right place, right time — as Mars zips past Jupiter, Earth will be in the perfect spot to see the two planets look as if they are within arm's reach.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
